metadata.title: CVE-2018-2667 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent:Server: Optimizer). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.20 andprior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows high privileged attackerwith network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server.Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized abilityto cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQLServer. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 4.9 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-2667` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.21-1ubuntu1
mysql-client - 5.7.21-1ubuntu1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.21-1ubuntu1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.21-1ubuntu1
mysql-server - 5.7.21-1ubuntu1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.21-1ubuntu1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.21-1ubuntu1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.21-1ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.21-1ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.21-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.21-1ubuntu1').
